adjective.description: Of a sound or letter: uttered using the vocal cords; voiced.
Syllabic; capable of forming a syllable, or of constituting the essential element of a syllable.

noun.description: A syllabic sound; (now usually) a syllabic consonant, or one that can be either syllabic or non-syllabic.

origin: Early 17th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin sonant-, sonāns, present participle of sonāre to sound.
